docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 18. -General Francisco Villa, head of the so-called Convention Government of Mexico, has agreed to accept the invitation of the United States, Brazil, Chile, Argentina, Bolivia, Uruguay, and Guatemala to participate in a conference for the purpose of establishing orderly government in his country, it is expected that Villa's acceptance will be presented to the Secretary of State tomorrow by Senor Llorente, the Villa agent here.

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27. -- Word reached Washington today that General Carranza expected to go to Mexico City in the next few days, probably on Sunday, and that most of the members of the Carranza Cabinet had already gone to the capital. The State Department received word today that documents and effects belonging to the Government were being transferred from Vera Cruz to Mexico City.
